programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: When Chrissy and Janet go away for the weekend, Jack throws a wild party and Stanley Roper gets the morning-after blues.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack and Chrissy walk in while Janet is entertaining a date, fostering a new rule on privacy.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack and Chrissy apparently do Janet a disfavor by talking her into trying for a promotion at the florist shop where she works.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Greed tarnishes Mr. Roper's integrity when he is led to believe his old car is a valuable classic after he has sold it for $200 to Jack, Janet and Chrissy.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack defends Chrissy's honor when a man who misunderstood her friendliness shows up at the apartment and no one knows he's a cop.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: A ruffled Helen Roper takes a cafeteria job to teach husband Stanley a lesson, but returns a wreck from the experience.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Janet moves in with Mrs. Roper while Mr. Roper is away on business, then stews about Jack and Chrissy being alone for the night in the trio's upstairs apartment.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Chrissy, whose skills in the kitchen aren't exactly sharp, invited a gourmet to share a home-cooked dinner, then pleads with Jack to be her secret stand-in-chef.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Only Jack knows the truth when Chrissy, Janet and Mrs. Roper think Stanley is fooling around with another woman.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Roper's on a rampage for the rent so Jack's visiting uncle, a charming rascal, passes him a bad check.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen adores the Brookes' boy, David, which leads her to feel she and Stanley could adopt a baby. Stanley is against it. Still, she calls an agency and sets up a home interview.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Stanley's going to be in trouble if Helen finds out he's lost her new puppy "Muffin" on a walk. He decides that a look-alike just might fool her and get him off the hook. Will Stanley get away with it or be barked at by Helen?

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: The clock Stanley gives Helen for their anniversary turns out to be stolen from Brookes' apartment.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: To get Vicky to accept his standing marriage proposal, Jack attempts to reunite Vicky's divorced parents. First appearance of Mrs. Bradford.

programme.desc: While Nick chats up a girl on the internet, Michael's bought a pet rabbit which soon weaves its way into the family.

programme.desc: Michael is being bullied by a classmate, and Susan discusses the issue with the boy's parents. Meanwhile, Janey is determined to get a tattoo.

programme.desc: Ben learns a patient's son is making advances toward his daughter. Susan has tickets to the opera.

programme.desc: Ben takes Susan away for her birthday, and Nick is left in charge.

programme.desc: Nick needs a job and Susan volunteers to hire him to work with her. Meanwhile Ben inadvertently calls Janey a prostitute as the two discuss her boyfriends.
